title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007 mandates coverage for independent foster care adolescents under the Social Security Act. Amendments include adding a new subclause and making conforming changes to existing clauses. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to section 1902 and 1903 regarding foster care coverage for independent adolescents. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to various sections, including 1902(a)(10)(A)(I)(VII), 1905, 1916(I), and 1916A(b)(3), by updating references from (XIX) to (XVIII) and (XVIII) to (XVII) in different subsections. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to various sections, including updating references from (XIX) to (XVIII) and (XVIII) to (XVII) in different subsections, with an effective date starting from October 1, 2007. The State plan for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act must meet additional requirements imposed by amendments. Failure to meet these requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session will not be considered non-compliance solely for that reason. If a State has a 2-year legislative session, each year is deemed a separate regular session.
